Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: mrilovemaga
Reviews.Content: Room was good although the pictures on the website and such do appear much nicer!! was a nice place, staff were friendly and generally clean. the breakfast was cracking though, pastry, bread, lovely cappucino, cereal! would come here again, the price in comparison to other hotels around the area and city definately made up for the small downfall of the shower (good shower but the bathroom got flooded due to the showr curtains being too short!)

Reviews.Title: “Basecamp....... thats about it”
Reviews.Author: SF_Scots
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome so we were looking forward to it, and knew we would spend most of the time out of the hotel as there is more than plenty of sights to see, however we still wanted to enjoy our time at the hotel when we were not sightseeing. Firstly the hotel is not in the best of areas, and the building isnt just fior this hotel, there are others attached to it. The staff, as is typical with Italians, were not very pleasant. They were never openly rude, however i dont think they know how to smile, or even went out there way to be friendly. The one and only real plus point is it is located 5 mins away from the main termini, which is very handy for getting about to all the various sights and locations, however be advised no matter what time we seemed to go the metro was always busy. Breakfast in the hotel consists of cereal (corn flakes or coc pops) a roll, selection of pastries and 2 slices of toast ........ in a packet. And again to demonstrate the staff, every morning i had to ask for something, a bowl, spoons, a cup for juice (which you will also have to use to store milk for your tea as they dont offer it for you). It is a small dining area, which also doubles up as a bar...... however its closed untill someone asks to have a drink there. Hotel offers wifi, but only in a small room on across from reception. Our room, seemed more like an old office, high ceilings with that sort of sqaure pollystyrene you find, and the bathroom was a small box in one corner. It was concrete floors, which helped in making the room cold to stay in, no heating, and the air con was switched off the whole time. It basically was a tired and worn looking room (corners dirty and peeling, hole in the main door, bath stained, bathroom smelt), also the bathroom isnt well laid out, expect to have the sink in your face whilst using the toilet. Sleep quality wasnt the best, as apsart from having the one wafer thin pillow, there was also the fact there was a dip in one side of the bed, and each morning you were woken up to the sound of cars, shouting from outside and sirens. The other thing was there was nothing in the area for going to at night, a few restaraunts in surroundings streets, but not like somewhere you can go for a drink unless you went up to the main termini area, but its not a walk where you can stroll and enjoy the ambience of the area, simply walking up with lots of tall buildings and the odd occasional passer by. There was no dinning on offer within the hotel. There is a telly in the room, however unless you speak italian there is no point having it switched on. Overall unless your happy with just having a bed for the night then this is fine, if your looking for more to a break with something to do at night, i wouldnt recomend here. Rome Is a fantastic sightseeing city, but for us the hotel brought the overall experience down

Reviews.Title: “Fine but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: kiwistroller
Reviews.Content: I cannot say I enjoyed my stay here, but it was good enough for what we needed. This hotel is the first I have stayed in where the wall area of each wall was bigger than the floor area. Not really a problem for my wife and I as we spent most of our time out of the hotel. This was made easy as the hotel is well placed and is a 5 min walk from Termini with the train, tube and bus links. We even managed to walk from the airport bus stop at Termini to the hotel with our 20 kg suitcases. Breakfasts are good here, in the european continental style. Good rolls, cake, satisfactory fruit and yoghurt, tea as good as in most small european hotels - I should really start drinking coffee though. Reception staff are the usual Roman offhand (its a culture thing), but once you get over that are helpful with maps and guides, willing to put up with our school-standard Italian and happy to book our taxi to the airport. Only snag was the unexpected "tourist tax", which was sprung on us as we left. A bit of warning might have been useful as we tend to budget our currency pretty tightly. Back to the room. We were on the 3rd floor in a standard room. It was quiet, warm, had a poor outlook but we did not mind, bed was comfortable enough, but so small, partially due to the en-suite being inserted. We found turning around in this en-suite tricky. But the shower was ok, the bath was not full length but could have been usable if we had wanted to. Incidently, the internet PC did not work but there was wireless in the hotel. I would check it just in case. So overall, a modest hotel, good as a base to sleep in and have breakfast, but if you expect more you may be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok”
Reviews.Author: flyga
Reviews.Content: If you have moderat expectations this hotel is ok. The rooms are simpel but functional. The breakfast are ok, with bread marmelade, yougourt and coffee. The Hotel is close to the station, and there are some small nice resturantes in the neighberhood.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value”
Reviews.Author: anne t
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time hotel was better than we thought and easy access to where ever u want. We got a great price 1 nite free with breakfast, thought it would be basic and we were givenlots even fruit. We had lunch at Macdonalds cheese burger and coffee milkshake 2 euro. Afternoon tea at the station brioche and coffee 2 euro fabulous and evening all inclusive ranging from euro to 15 euro around the hotel. Rome we chose a tour bus 4 2 days 18 euro well worth it. Best site for me was the streets how they live with so much archutexture amazes me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, don't expect anything else”
Reviews.Author: sianda
Reviews.Content: Good location, only 5 minutes from Termini with plenty of restaurants around. We booked superior room, but on arrival were shown into standard, after complaining we've been transferred into room we originally booked. Room was clean, only disappointment was that our double bed consisted of 2 single beds pushed together ( when you book superior room, you must specify if you want double or twin), so we couldn't cuddle up together :(. Breakfast was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great history and monuments but otherwise unfriendly city and people!”
Reviews.Author: H V
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was nice large and clean for the two adults and children. The bathroom was tiny in comparison and the shower space was inadequate for even one person to stand and not hit the faucet (and turn on extremely hot or cold water) while turning about. It was almost as if the bathroom was put there on an afterthought. The even tinier elevator refused to move with just two adults and one infant plus two bags. Please avoid using it. Cleaning in the corridors could be improved and more lights could be provided. The worst part however was that though we inadvertently arrived in Rome on the day of protest (15th Oct.), no one at the hotel or elsewhere bothered to tell us about it and we ended up at Colloseum with an infant in a stroller in the middle of the unending protest March with noisy,rancourous and sometime violent marchers when we could have gone somewhere else! What were they protesting for anyway with liqour in their hands and ciggerettes in mouths - the end of their easy carefree life?!? But it is just the common European uncaring and non customer friendly attitude that you will see everywhere. Rome is a great city. I only hope that the people could be friendlier. After all their livlihoods depend on the tourists mostly.

Reviews.Title: “Ok I suppose”
Reviews.Author: Cameron R
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights. The location is excellent. A run down area but safe and handy for the rail Termini. Also there is an excellent restaurant about 5 mins away which I went to 3 nights out of four. The staff at the Hotel were pretty much like all Romans are to tourists. They generally seem to resent tourists and whilst not openly rude, are not especially friendly. I won't be back to Rome any time soon so their crashing economy won't get my money. The shower in my room stank of sewers but was generally OK by morning and the smell didn't pervade the room if the door was shut. If I turned the shower head upside down, the pressure was so low the water nearly stopped coming out and the water temperature was warm at best but no problem really. The 5th floor room was run down but clean and OK to crash. I've been in better in Guatemala for less than a dollar a night. Not a place for romance. Wi-fi was free for guests (in lobby only) and the breakfasts were plentiful and fine. But.....That Roman attitude? Why do they do that? Nearly forgot... the room was incredibly noisy despite my request for a quiet room. Loads of air conditioning units (I guess, but not mine, which was pitiful) going off with one particularly noisy one. I was so knackered I slept through it mostly, but it may not be for everyone. I won't be going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but good.”
Reviews.Author: SarahK85
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel, but clean and friendly staff. Room was basic but large with decent shower. Location was excellent, right next to termini station where all trains, buses, metros and airport transfers go from. Staff very helpful regarding places to eat and buses to get there.

Reviews.Title: “warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: appyarrys
Reviews.Content: great central location 3 minute walk from termini with our case , helpful staff, clean rooms relaxed atmosphere . rooms were cleaned everyday fresh towels mini bar priced reasonable had a good stay breakfast was good plenty of food choice available extra coffees not a problem would highly recommend.had good stay here. warm friendly staff very helpful free guide book with your stay very helpful travel using buses 1 euro for 75mins travel get coloceum early 8:30am to avoid Q had great time thanks to all xxx karen n tony

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay, but if you're only planning to sleep there, it does the job.”
Reviews.Author: timeywimeykid
Reviews.Content: Good location 5 minutes away from Termini, food available to buy at Spar and a handful of nice inexpensive restaurants and bars around. Stayed with 3 other people and only had 1 key for all, you can imagine how inconvenient it was when we split up. Only 1 elevator, fit 3 people, so had to wait ages to go up or down. Staff was very rude: when a couple of friends staying at another hotel visited us for a couple of minutes, they got kicked out; staff explained in bad English something about "police regulations" although I've never experienced anything like this at other hotels. Checked "yes" on "Free High Speed Internet", but 1)definitely not high speed, 2)wifi only works downstairs in a small Internet cafe, not enough spare sockets for laptops. Rooms small but in good condition. No closet: had to keep all clothes in suitcases. Acceptable for student trips with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money if on budget”
Reviews.Author: teekay_cz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel 2 days prior our arrival in Rome. The price was around 100 euro so our expectations were not unrealistic. That being said, the hotel is situated in a convenient central location, so we could take long walks around the major points of interest and not have to worry about taking a taxi etc. The quadruple room we had was clean but felt like it was furnished 20 years ago. Then again we only used it to have a good night's sleep after a tiring sight-seeing session. Don't come here for a romantic experience but rather a good value for money considering how expensive Rome can be, esp. if you are a large family like us. If single, look elsewhere, but for the 5 of us it made a lot of sense to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Woo78
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night, but the hotel was good value, quiet, clean and comfortable. It does exactly what it should for the price and location (5 mins to Termini), plus has free WiFi and breakfast included. I would recommend to anyone who is more concerned with budget and location, than a fancy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just alright...takes a bit of time to get used to”
Reviews.Author: Silvermouse82
Reviews.Content: First impressions were 'oh my god what did we just pay for'. But once you get used to the weirdly designed onsuite and really noisy toilet it wasn't that bad. The room is awful and the way the next door toilet can be heard like a train going through your room when flushed doesn't allow for much sleep! That said, it is clean and in an ok location. The old man at the front desk was very very friendly as well. Overall just okay in a goodish location!

Reviews.Title: “Don't, Just Don't”
Reviews.Author: majr13
Reviews.Content: WORSE STAY EVER: -broken shower -broken television -smoke smell -horrible service -broken a/c Our shower was broken and when we complained, they tried to blame us for breaking the shower head because we were "Ignorant Americans" Dont, it was awful and they had no sympathy or service.

Reviews.Title: “Small, tired and very very basic”
Reviews.Author: Sully_Caffs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend back in SEPTEMBR 2009. The area is fine in terms of proximity to the station, it is central and well connected. However it's quite a dirty area and not particularly pleasant. The building is a tall narrow terrace which is shared with other hotels (they all have a floor or two each). The first impression is not good and is of a very tired, old building in need of renovation. The reception area matched as did the lift, the corridors (which felt almost prison like) and the rooms. Our room was less than small - extremley cramped and basic. The furniture was well past it's sell by date and the bathroom did not leave me feeling clean and refreshed, it was in need of a complete overhaul. However general cleanliness was ok. The breakfast was a bit of a joke, not really any food there, just some bread and cereal and the coffee was awful! I would say this is a 2* hotel rather than 3*. It was however one of the cheaper hotels in Rome so you get what you pay for I suppose. Would only recommend to shoe-string travellers who are on a very tight budget and willing to put up with low standards.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value-felt like I was staying at my grandmom's house!”
Reviews.Author: sportsshrink
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 5 night stay at the Hotel Cambridge in the Termini area of Rome. I wanted a place to stay close to Termini Station having stayed in Rome before. I was going to take several side trips outside of Rome so I wanted to have quick and easy access to the station. This was the first time I took the Leonardo Express train from the airport into the city. Getting off the train was a bit disorienting since the platform is a bit removed from the heart of the station. If you keep moving inside of the station and walk in the direction of the lower numbered tracks you are walking in the right direction. Exit the station on side that runs parallel to track 1 and you will be good to go. the Cambridge is about 4 blocks away--about a 5 minute walk. Check in was smooth and easy--there is a small lift to get you and your luggage to your room. My room would have been reasonably comfortable for 2 people. The room was small but clean. The bed was firm and comfortable. Most reasonably priced rooms in Rome are this size. If you are there on holiday, if you spend more thatn one waking hour in your hotel room you are missing out!!! I stayed in a room on the level above reception, it was very quiet. Since the building is old and solidly built, I heard no traffic noise and very little hallway noise. The shower was piping hot. Be careful stepping down out of the shower. Use the shower mat because with wet feet on tile, the floor can be slippery. There is a small refrigerator in the room. Rooms are very secure since you need a key to at least enter the hallway on the level above reception and then a key to enter your room. The hallways are monitored 24 hours a day by reception. The breakfast is simple but nicely served. There is coffee, juice, yogurt, pastries, breakfast rolls, cereal, cheese, fruit, butter, and jelly. A few tips about staying in this area--try some of the small cafes located all around the hotel. If you are on a budget--shop at the Despar market at the Termini Station for food. Bottled water there is about 40 cents for 1.5 liters. I even bought a bottle of Despar brand red table wine for under 1 euro. It was actually drinkable! Enjoy this part of the city--it is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “great value very clean and easy to find”
Reviews.Author: andyandshelly
Reviews.Content: This was a very good hotel for the price and considering what you would pay everywhere else in Rome it's probably better than that!! OK it aint a top notch Ritz hotel however i have stayed in some very top notch hotels and this is just as clean remember Italian people are very clicky but a few smiles and a bit of a laugh goes a long way and me and my girlfriend really enjoyed our stay at the Cambridge. Its very close to the Termini station and all of the tourist attractions are within walking distance and easy to find the bar around the corner called the Oasis is a real scream and so is the banana bar were you can rent an ipad for an hour for 5 Euro the food and resturaunts close by is sublime on the whole a real slice of Rome. At an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in Rome- friendly, clean, near train/bus station,”
Reviews.Author: 186525Wanderer
Reviews.Content: We looked at all reviews and searched for other hotels but given our budget, and in Rome you need a large budget for a good hotel, we decided on the Cambridge. We found the receptionists and breakfast staff very helpful and friendly. All spoke English and/or made an effort to understand. The room was clean, bright, - yes basic but ideal if you are out sightseeing and just need a comfy bed, clean bathroom, fresh towels and a good breakfast. The hotel is literally 5 mins walk from the Termini/train station - perfect for bus tours and the underground. A few good restaurants in the area providing home made meals and family atmosphere. We would recommed the Cambridge.

Reviews.Title: “Good value/location”
Reviews.Author: AMP00
Reviews.Content: Good budget hotel for the money. Nothing fancy. Room was clean and big enough for 2 people. It included a clean bathroom, tv, and minibar. Staff was friendly and helpful, although did not speak much english. Great location from Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “good little budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: moshiface
Reviews.Content: stayed in the quad room for 3 days during our visit to rome. this hotel is very basic, with no frills attached.i.e you get what you pay for. but the hotel does the job in providing a tidy clean room with comfortable beds and simple breakfasts. the main positive is that it is so close to the termini station and walkable distances to the city attractions. the staff were also very friendly and helpful and there are 2 computers in the lobby available for use. the main negative is that the bathroom was very small and thus it smelt quite damp and moist

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozzietripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights for 80 euro incl breakfast after finding out that just about every other hotel was charging more in the same neighborhood. Good location not too far from the railway station and down a side street. The room was ok but the bath/shower area was far too Little and you couldn't move easily! The staff friendly and reasonably helpful and breakfast just ok. Will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “if you need good location - go for it !”
Reviews.Author: ArkadiuszW
Reviews.Content: nice and clean hotel with perfect location - 5 min walk from train station . we stayed there 3 days - 75euro per night with breakfast its really good deal like for Rome. Room quite big with massive bed , nice and clean bathroom. Friendly staff and all of them speak English. only 1 thing i didn't like was no wi-fi in the room. i would recommend for budget holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Un buon hotel e l'ambiente simpatico.”
Reviews.Author: stella_gg
Reviews.Content: The Cambridge Hotel is a quiet hotel near Termini station - the central station of Rome. The room and the en-suit are not so big, but very nice and clean. There is a television and Internet . The staff is very friendly and speaks English. The atmosphere in the hotel is really pleasant. I think hotel Cambridge is recommendable and reasonable. I can't believe bad reviews I read! Have a nice journey in Roma - la città Eterna!

Reviews.Title: “Most Awful Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Nikikki
Reviews.Content: After reading the good reviews on this site, we booked a night here for our stop over in Rome. Upon arrival, the staff were very unfriendly, unhelpful and one girl inparticlar was downright rude. We were shown to a twin room, despite booking a double, and were ignored after our request to change rooms. And the stench was unbelievable - the room had an "en-suite", which was actually a wetroom consisting of a broken shower head positioned over a toilet, built into the corner which was partitioned by a plastic folding door that was hanging off its hinges. The whole room and bathroom was disgustingly filthy. The cleaner came up to pour bleach over the bathroom floor and claimed her job was done. The air conditioning didn't work, and the noise from outside made it impossible to keep the window open and get a decent nights sleep. The sheets on the bed were dirty, and were crinkled as though they hadn't been changed after the previous guests, and the flimsy door to our room even had a hole in it. Paying 50 euros for the night we weren't expecting any frills, but what we got was disgusting, smelly and filthy. I would not reccomend anybody stay here in a million years.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a poor choice”
Reviews.Author: Wy0mingTraveler
Reviews.Content: Cannot really recommend this hotel. The best thing I can say is that it's close to Termini, but the desk staff were very unpleasant (especially one young lady) and they tried to cheat us on our bill. They were also extremely unhelpful when our group's travel plans changed slightly; we wanted to get a smaller (less expensive room) for our second night there and we made the request when we first arrived, but they refused to do it. When I got the bill they had even overcharged us for what we had, and the night deskman doesn't speak English so he could not/would not change it. I will have to take this up with my credit card company if I want the bill to be corrected. The room was extremely small and stuffy, and the bathroom was so small you couldn't use it without bumping into the walls. If you want a hotel in Rome, I urge you to look further. This was not a good ending to our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal For Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kingart55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights pre-cruise as we wanted to be close to the train station. The hotel was about a 5 minute walk from the station and you had to go up about a half flight of stairs to reach the reception. We had a nice room facing into a courtyard which made it quiet at night. Since it was before June 1 they were not sure if the a/c would work. It barely worked but was not to bad at night as we also left the window open. The bathroom was large and had a marble floor. The shower in the tub had no curtain or rod for one so you had to be careful upon getting out. There were lots of restaurants in the area and it was easy when we took the train to Civitavecchia. There was a small elevator that can be described as triple phone booth. For Rome I thought it was a good deal

Reviews.Title: “well located-no frills-quiet-clean”
Reviews.Author: terrabrasilis
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay overnight (arriving in Rome, leaving next day for Tuscany). This hotel was just 5-7min walk from Termini train station, near restaurants (quite nice and inexpensive). The room was small but very pleasant and clean. Great air-conditioning and the bathroom, although small, mas nice. Internet access possible in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: momonga68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights in mid September and found our stay much better than expected. This is a no frill hotel so don't expect anything fancy. We think the rating is somewhere between 2 and 3 stars. Very convinient location; only 5 min walk from Termini. There are some nice restaurants close by, we didn't have to look for a place to eat. The room was adequately furbished, a good double bed, wardrobe, drawers, mini-bar fridge, tv and en suite shower/toilet (very clean). As some of the reviewers pointed out that the air condition was not working. We just aired the room after coming back to our room in the evening and it wasn't a problem for us, though. Good breakfast- a sellection of Italian rolls to choose from, cereals, fruit juices and very good coffee. Staff were all very friendly and courteous. Some of them spoke good English. Other guests were mostly Italian tourists. For a short stay, we would definately recommand staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, and exceleent housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: ffmdave
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Cambridge during the first weekend of the month. Conveniently located near the Termini, found the staff very accommodating on check in. Room was typical for a small Italian hotel. Was in Rome on business so it met my needs - a comfortable, easily accessible, clean place to lay my head. The breakfast was also typical of small Italian hotels, if you've stayed in Germany, you'll probably be underwhelmed by the offering, but then again, it's Italy, not Germany. I would not hesitate to stay Cambridge again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 2 star hotel at best”
Reviews.Author: MarabelleM
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through verene.com and it was advertised as a 3 star hotel. It's not. At best it is a 2 star hotel so please compare this hotel against other 2 star hotels. The service provided was fine - they provided new towels each day and the room looked like it was clean. There are mainly 4 issues that I found with this hotel. The 1st is the inflated rating as noted earlier. It really belong with 2 star hotels. The 2nd is that they advertise that they have an elevator and air conditioning. But the air conditioner barely works. Air came out of it but it felt more like a fan on low setting. It was so hot and the only thing you can do is take a shower and hope it cools you down. Also there is an elevator but there are several steps that you have to climb first to get to the elevator so this is not the place for those that are disabled or anyone that needs an elevator. The 3rd is the condition of the hotel. Other reviews had mentioned how the hotel looks old and the furnishings are old which is true. However if you're looking for a bargain I think that is to be expected but what I didn't expect was how poor the room was in. I posted some pictures to show what I mean. The 4th is the location of the hotel. It is located in a building with at least 2 or 3 other hotels. The check-in office for the Cambridge hotel is located on the ground floor but I don't even know how the staff there can tell who is a hotel guest or not since anyone that comes in might be going up to another hotel. So essentially any stranger can walk in and not be questioned. I would not recommend this hotel even for someone that is on a budget. Rome is a great city with many things to see. However i found myself in a situation where I would be exhausted from walking around Rome and I didn't even want to go back to my hotel room. It was that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Pick another”
Reviews.Author: lupaling
Reviews.Content: This place advertised individually controled air-conditioning. The was a control in the room, but only tepid air came out if the air-conditioner. Good thing we could open the windows to get some cool air or we would have cooked overnight. Very small bathroom of that Italian design that gets water all over the floor every time you shower. We only stayed here one night after we arrrived from Termini and we left for FCO in the morning. The place looked kind of thread-worn but I expected that being near Termini. It was close enough top walk to from Termini. Even though we only stayed here one night, they managed to over-bill us, charging my credit card for 2 nights. Hopefully my bank will straighten this out. With all the hotels near Termini, there is no reason to stay here. Pick another one where maybe the shower is better, the air conditioning works, and they don't over-bill you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cambridge in Rome”
Reviews.Author: albas
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Cambridge in Rome April 2008 on a personal recommendation . The hotel is in a great location for the Tour Buses and Metro, also is only 5 minutes from the main rail terminal. The room was spotless and looked as though it had been recently decorated. The bathroom was more than adequate with a great multifunctional massaging shower.The staff were all very helpful, friendly and cheerful. If the breakfast room is full there is no extra charge for room service which is very prompt. The hotel bar is 'on demand' . The immediate area has lots of economical restaurants and the area is also on the quieter side of the rail terminal. I would not hesitate to recommend the Cambridge to travellers. Incidentally Trip Advisor , my review keeps coming up as Venice for some reason but this review is for the Hotel Cambridge in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Have a shower before you leave home.”
Reviews.Author: Dan173
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my Italian partner for two nights over New Year's Eve after booking online and reading the reviews. I think there must be another part of the hotel which is ok because otherwise I can't believe anyone would write a good review of it. The only good points were that the hotel is in a quiet central location and it was kept as clean as possible, with the beds made and fresh towels provided on the second day. However the room was shabby and reminded me of cheap hotels in North Africa. (the only difference being that it would not cost 100 euro a night in Tunisia or Egypt). There was no way that this was a 3 star hotel and I realised that I had been naive in believing the star rating). The toilet was shared, which would have been fine if they had not been in two smelly cubicles which were shared with showers. The staff were reasonably polite but clearly bored and incompetent and were unable to provide hot water, despite my partner's constant phone calls to the reception to tell them that the shower was cold. We were constantly told that we should "wait ten minutes" while people went up step ladders to fiddle with the water tank, but only we only managed to have one shower each in lukewarm water over the course of our two-day stay. We came home in need of a proper wash, which is unacceptable considering the price we paid. Finally, the radiator in the room did not work. Overall, I was shocked at the quality of this hotel for the price, even considering the time of year (which meant that we couldn't go elsewhere). There is a big difference between a basic hotel (such as the ETAP chain where I stayed in Paris the previous year for half the price) and a squalid one!

Reviews.Title: “noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Minhao
Reviews.Content: It's a 2 star hotel first of all! (shown from the booklet by the hotel itself) We paid 130 euro for one night staying and I do not see the value of money. The room is way too noisy both from the street and the corridor. The wall seemed to be made of thin wood board and we could easily hear our neighbors talking. When somebody flushes the toilet, it's like an earthquake especially in mid-night. The persons were nice and helpful, however. But thinking about the price and having a feeling that we were fooled by the star rating of the hotel, I didn't have a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful city, a bit less this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheBeautyLover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year. Even though I am Italian, it was my first time in Rome and I choose this hotel because of the reasonable price and its location, within walking distance from the main train station. I have to say that my room was clean and the bed large, but they looked old and not very attractive, and so was the bathroom. The lounge was really kitsch, filled with cheap items, probably bought at a five-and-ten store. The staff was far from being friendly, apart from the ageing man of the night shift who was a nice person. Breakfast was basic, not bad, but they seemed to save money on it, and you always had to ask if you want something more. However, I rarely spend much time in a hotel when in another city, so this place did not spoil my stay in lovely Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice, clean and very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ttmnguyen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on May 17th 2007 for a few days. I found that the hotel although shared the same building with others hotel (a bit cramped there) but the room is quite spacy (I have a large family of 6), very clean. The bathroom is quite new - probably they have just renovated the place. The price is some what a bit too high for me (I stayed in a four bed type room). Anyway, the area is very safe to walk at night - I have 4 very young children and feel very safe to venture out at night for dinner etc. Very close to termini station and that is a plus. Hotel staff is very helpful and very nice, friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: TravelingEurope2007
Reviews.Content: I was concerned when I read some of the reviews. Pleasantly suprised. We found this to be a very nice hotel. The hotel was just a few blocks from the train station, making easy access to all major attractions. Room was adequate size for two travelers. Beds were comfortable. Bedding was not so great, but after traveling in Rome, no problem sleeping. Room had pleasant decor. Bathroom was very nice, perhaps newly renovated. Hotel is on a street with a market below. If you are wanting to sleep in make sure your windows are shut. Internet access was available at a much lower rate then the local internet cafes. Staff was helpful and recommended a great place for dinner. Breakfast was simple and tasty. Delicious pastries were offered. Other choices include: Cappuchino, fruit juice, cereal, fresh fruit, bread, and crackers. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: orbiter1
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel Cambridge is near to Termini station, that is about all it has going for it. We paid 90 euros a night and were very disappointed. We booked a superior room, expecting a bit of luxury. Plug sockets were hanging off the wall, hairdryer nozzle broken in half, very small room and hopeless bathroom. The double bed was 2 singles pushed together. The website of the Cambridge advertised tea/coffee making facilities. There were none in the room and when challenged, the staff said they were in the breakfast room. This was locked all the time making it impossible to use. We would not reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Basic functional accomodation, cramped bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: rocksteady
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Cambridge "Triple" with 2 other adults for long weekend (3 nights). Location is good being 10mins walk to central terminus rail station and further to the various city attractions. There is a street market in the lane at side of the Hotel weekdays - some early morning noise may be experienced whilst they are setting up. Room was a spartan but functional double with pull-down bunk beds on ground floor. Decor was dull and with dim lighting even in daytime. Difficult to open shutters with locked bars on the window. Maybe this was not one of the re-furbished rooms. Bathroom was cramped with small bath, grubby toilet and basin squashed into a space less than 2m x 2m. There was a lockable safe in the room. Everything including hairdryer, TV and plumbing worked OK. Staff were friendly and reasonably helpful. Breakfast comprised a rather basic but acceptable continental serving, taken in the 1st floor breakfast room. Generally the Hotel falls short of what I would consider to be a 3 star property. However, reading other reviews, the same seems to be true for several other 3 star hotels in Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Cambridge
HotelInfo.Address: Via Palestro 87, 00185 Rome, Italy
